overview_of_class:
This class serves as an introduction to international relations (IR). We will attempt to tackle some of the "big questions" in IR. Examples include:
? Why are there wars?
? Are nuclear weapons dangerous or stabilizing?
? Why are some countries so poor? Is foreign aid the solution?
? Can China rise peacefully?
? What do terrorists want?
? Does international law prevent human rights abuses?
? Is the world getting safer?
name: Introduction to International Relations
title: WCAS POLI_SCI 240-0-20 Introduction to International Relations

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: The objective of this course is to give students the intellectual tools required to comprehend international politics in a sophisticated manner. By the end of the course, students should be able to (1) employ basic concepts in IR to analyze current world affairs, (2) identify the strengths and weaknesses different theoretical approaches to IR, and (3) become critical consumers of policy and journalistic writing on the subject.
